page.title: 19ALL SAINTS' CHURCH
page.content: The Domesday Book records that in 1086 Reschintone (Ruskington) there lived 38 families. There appears to have been a church here at that time, possibly Saxon,of timber construction and on the site of the present All Saints' building. The tower arch is Roman, circa 12th.century. The Roman church was replaced later in that same century by yet another. Further changes and additions to the structure were carried out over the next 700 years. Church relics include an Eliza- bethan register book and Burial Register started in 1678. The church holds the colours of the reconn- aissance units of The Parachute Regiment which were billeted in the area prior to taking part in the Battle of Arnhem. The present rector is Canon Stanley Jackson.
